item.title: 哈佛开发企业债券市场，抓住 "永不满足的需求
item.description: 哈佛大学拥有 AAA 信用评级和 500 亿美元的捐赠基金，可以轻松利用企业债券市场，摆脱近期围绕学校的争议。【原文：Harvard University — armed with a AAA credit rating and $50 billion endowment — easily tapped the corporate bond market, shrugging off recent controversies swirling around the school.】

item.title: 高盛看到了贪婪膨胀的迹象（某种迹象）
item.description:
最新研究发现，企业转嫁成本节约所需的时间比成本增加所需的时间更长。【原文：

New research finds that companies take longer to pass through cost savings than increases.

item.title: KKR 正洽谈以 20 多亿欧元收购能源公司 Encavis
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.公司正在洽谈收购可再生能源生产商 Encavis AG 公司，该交易对这家德国公司的估值可能超过 20 亿欧元（22 亿美元）。【原文：KKR & Co. is in talks to acquire renewable-energy producer Encavis AG in a deal that could value the German company at more than €2 billion ($2.2 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 财政忧虑令债券陷入困境，哥伦比亚反弹戛然而止
item.description: 哥伦比亚债券在第四季度出现的缓解性反弹已让位于今年发展中国家主权债券的最差表现之一。【原文：The relief rally in Colombian bonds that took place in the fourth quarter has given way to one of the worst performances across developing-nation sovereign bonds this year.】

item.title: Generali 首席执行官的战略计划包括 100 亿欧元的交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，作为保险公司发展计划的一部分，Assicurazioni Generali SpA 正在分析一系列潜在的收购候选人，其中一些候选人的价值超过 100 亿欧元（109 亿美元）。【原文：Assicurazioni Generali SpA is analyzing a range of potential takeover candidates as part of the insurer’s growth plans, with some of them worth more than €10 billion ($10.9 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 马克龙政府警告明年将削减更多开支
item.description: 法国预算部长托马斯-卡泽纳夫（Thomas Cazenave）表示，即使法国政府今年匆忙通过一轮削减措施来实现减赤目标，2025 年仍可能需要找到比此前预期更多的节余。【原文：The French government will likely have to find significantly greater savings than previously expected in 2025 even after rushing through a round of cuts this year to meet its deficit reduction targets, Budget Minister Thomas Cazenave said.】

item.title: 英国非家庭免税政策的终止令最富有的居民感到不安
item.description: 2024年3月6日星期三，英国伦敦，英国财政大臣杰里米-亨特（Jeremy Hunt）从唐宁街11号出发，向议会提交预算案。亨特计划在周三的年度预算案中将个人减税作为核心内容，因为他要应对紧张的公共财政，以满足保守党的要求，在大选前进行一次大派送，以提高萎靡不振的执政党在选民心目中的地位。摄影师：Chris J. Ratcliffe/Bloomberg【原文：Jeremy Hunt, UK chancellor of the exchequer, departs 11 Downing Street to present his budget to parliament in London, UK, on Wednesday, March 6, 2024. Hunt plans to put personal tax cuts at the center of his annual budget on Wednesday as he navigates tight public finances to deliver on Conservative demands for a pre-election giveaway to boost the ailing governing party’s standing with voters. Photographer: Chris J. Ratcliffe/Bloomberg】

item.title: 派拉蒙洽谈向安巴尼的 Reliance 出售印度电视台股份
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）正在讨论将其在印度的合资媒体公司的股份出售给穆克什-安巴尼（Mukesh Ambani）的信实工业有限公司（Reliance Industries Ltd.），这位亚洲首富将继续巩固其在全球增长最快的娱乐市场之一的影响力。【原文：Paramount Global is in discussions to sell its stake in its media joint venture in India to Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Industries Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter, as Asia’s richest man continues to consolidate his clout in one of the world’s fastest-growing entertainment markets.】

item.title: 黄金刚刚创下新纪录。下一步值得关注
item.description: 黄金本周飙升至创纪录水平，令许多分析师感到困惑，也迫使交易商们自问，黄金还能涨多少。【原文：Gold’s surge to a record this week has baffled many analysts and forced traders to ask themselves just how much further it can go.】

item.title: 捷克亿万富翁希望帮助乌克兰生产更多弹药
item.description: 在西方援助不断减少的情况下，乌克兰正努力击退俄罗斯的入侵，欧洲最大的军火制造商之一表示愿意帮助乌克兰加强重型弹药的自主生产。【原文：One of Europe’s biggest arms manufacturers is offering to help Ukraine ramp up its own production of heavy ammunition as the country struggles to repel the Russian invasion amid dwindling western aid.】

item.title: 拉丁美洲开发银行计划与全球同行一起简化贷款选项
item.description: 拉丁美洲最大的开发银行正在推动编制一本包含不同贷款工具的手册，供其他多边机构共享，以提高贷款的影响力。【原文：Latin America’s top development bank is pushing for a manual with different lending instruments that can be shared among fellow multilateral institutions to boost the impact of their loans.】

item.description: 纽约州的立法者们正在重新推动对解决主权债务危机这一漫长而痛苦的过程进行全面改革。【原文：New York state lawmakers are renewing the push to overhaul the protracted and painful process of solving sovereign debt crises.】

item.title: 英国将出售 2,650 亿英镑债务，基本符合市场预期
item.description: 英国政府宣布的下一财政年度借贷计划与市场预期基本一致，这为 2024 年迄今为止表现最差的主要债券市场之一提供了一些安慰。【原文：The UK government announced borrowing plans for the coming fiscal year that were broadly in line with the market’s expectations, providing some relief for one of the worst-performing major bond markets so far in 2024.】

item.title: 随着股价下滑，RWE 面临越来越大的回购股票压力
item.description: 分析师和激进投资者正加紧呼吁德国公用事业公司 RWE AG 回购股票并分拆其褐煤业务，以提振该公司低迷的股价。【原文：Analysts and activist investors are stepping up calls for German utility RWE AG to buy back shares and spin-off its lignite operations to bolster the company’s depressed stock price.】

item.title: 也门海岸附近发生最新船只袭击事件，船只被击中并受损
item.description: 一艘商品船在也门附近被导弹击中后起火漂流，一名美国官员预计船上的 20 名船员将因此丧生。【原文：A commodity ship was on fire and drifting near Yemen after being hit by a missile, with a US official expecting fatalities among the 20 crew members on board.】

item.title: 英国亨特将北海油气暴利税延长一年
item.description: 英国财政大臣杰里米-亨特（Jeremy Hunt）表示，他将把对石油和天然气公司利润征收的暴利税延长一年。【原文：UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt said he would extend the windfall tax on the profits of oil and gas companies by one year.】

item.title: 鲍威尔重申美联储需要对通胀有更多信心才能降息
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）向立法者重申，在政策制定者确信他们赢得了与通胀的斗争之前，美国央行并不急于降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell reiterated to lawmakers that the US central bank is in no rush to cut interest rates until policymakers are convinced they have won their battle over inflation.】

item.title: 加拿大顶级养老基金在公开信中向首席执行官施压，要求增加国内投资
item.description: 近 100 位加拿大顶级商界领袖签署了一封致财政部长克里斯蒂娅-弗里兰（Chrystia Freeland）及其省级同行的公开信，敦促他们改变养老基金的投资规则，以 "鼓励他们在加拿大投资"。【原文：Almost 100 top Canadian business leaders have signed an open letter to Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland and her provincial counterparts, urging them to change investment rules for pension funds to “encourage them to invest in Canada.”】

item.title: 阿根廷人向银行投入 23 亿美元，表明对米莱的信心
item.description: 自哈维尔-米莱总统于 12 月 10 日就职以来，阿根廷人已将超过 23 亿美元存入以美元计价的当地银行账户，这反映出阿根廷人对其政府的乐观态度。【原文：Argentines have deposited more than $2.3 billion into dollar-denominated local bank accounts since President Javier Milei took office Dec. 10, reflecting incipient optimism about his government.】

item.title: 对冲基金押注雪佛龙战胜埃克森完成赫斯交易
item.description: 在雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp. ）10 月份收购赫斯公司（Hess Corp. ）的交易上押注数十亿美元的对冲基金经理们正坚持他们的赌注，尽管另一个障碍有可能会破坏这一收购。【原文：Hedge fund managers that wagered billions on Chevron Corp.’s October deal to buy Hess Corp. are sticking to their bets despite another roadblock that could potentially torpedo the acquisition.】

item.title: 石油行业因气候问题受到内部批评
item.description:
SLB老板 奥利维耶-勒佩赫（Olivier Le Peuch）希望在减少钻井、压裂和抽水产生的排放方面取得更快进展，但在评论中却绕过了范围3污染。【原文：

SLB boss Olivier Le Peuch wants faster progress in reducing emissions from drilling, fracking and pumping but bypasses Scope 3 pollution in comments.

item.title: 亨特称英国经济增长好于预期，支持保守党
item.description: 杰里米-亨特（Jeremy Hunt）表示，英国的经济增长将强于预算监督机构此前的预测，这将在今年晚些时候举行的大选前为执政党保守党带来鼓舞。【原文：Jeremy Hunt said UK growth is due to be stronger than previously forecast by the budget watchdog, a boost for the ruling Conservative Party ahead of an election expected later this year.】

item.title: 市场升温，鲍威尔与华尔街 "微妙共舞
item.description: 自从美联储开始收紧政策以来，杰罗姆-鲍威尔一直乐于忽视一种形式的通胀：资产价格上涨。【原文：Ever since the Federal Reserve began its policy-tightening campaign, Jerome Powell has been happy to ignore one form of inflation: Rising asset prices.】

item.title: 借贷成本高企，巴西工业产值年初下滑
item.description: 年初，巴西的工业产值大幅下降，这对未来几个月的经济增长前景是一个令人担忧的信号。【原文：Brazil’s industrial output fell sharply at the beginning of the year, a worrying sign for the prospects of economic growth in the months ahead.】

item.title: 贝莱德经理预测银行风险转移交易将激增 40
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc）预测，随着更严格的资本规定的实施，允许银行降低贷款组合风险的交易将快速增长。【原文：BlackRock Inc. is forecasting rapid growth for transactions that allow banks to shed risk in their loan portfolios as tougher capital rules take hold.】
